array.string: Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria assassinated
Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria and his wife, Sophie, are assassinated by a Bosnian Serb nationalist in Sarajevo.
World War I begins when Austria-Hungary declares war on Serbia.
First Battle of the Marne begins.
First Battle of the Marne begins. The Germans had advanced to within 30 miles of Paris, but over the next two days, the French are reinforced by 6,000 infantrymen.
War is declared to the Ottaman Empire
Britain and France declare war on the Ottoman Empire.
The Second Battle of Ypres begins
The German army initiates the modern era of chemical warfare by launching a chlorine attack on Allied trenches. Some 5,000 French and Algerian troops are killed.
Over the next 10 months, the French and German armies at Verdun, France, suffer over 700,000 casualties, including some 300,000 killed.
